timeline.title: Agreement Effective Date
timeline.description: Agreement takes effect upon approval by COMMISSION governing board and notification to proceed by Contract Manager.

timeline.title: First Progress Report Submission
timeline.description: CONSULTANT must submit first written progress report with invoice within 45 days of work commencement.

timeline.title: Mid-Term Audit Review
timeline.description: COMMISSION may conduct interim audit of records as per Section 12; CONSULTANT must provide access.

timeline.title: Final Deliverable Submission
timeline.description: All deliverables must be completed and submitted for COMMISSION acceptance by agreement end date.

timeline.title: Final Invoice Deadline
timeline.description: CONSULTANT must submit final invoice within 60 days after acceptance of work by Contract Manager.

penalty_forecast.label: Month 1
penalty_forecast.description: Initial payment with processing fees as per Fee Schedule

penalty_forecast.label: Month 3
penalty_forecast.description: Accumulated late fees and penalties for delayed progress reports

penalty_forecast.label: Month 6
penalty_forecast.description: Maximum penalty scenario for repeated non-compliance and delays

narratives.title: Default Termination Due to Insurance Lapse
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT fails to maintain required insurance coverage
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT's comprehensive general liability insurance expires without renewal. COMMISSION issues a 10-day notice to cure, but CONSULTANT fails to provide new certificates. COMMISSION terminates agreement for default under Section 4B. CONSULTANT is liable for reprocurement costs of ₹200,000 and any additional damages incurred.

narratives.title: Delay in Progress Reports Causes Payment Hold
narratives.subtitle: CONSULTANT misses progress report deadlines
narratives.narrative: CONSULTANT submits invoices without required progress reports for two consecutive months. COMMISSION delays payments as per Section 2E and issues a warning. Continued non-compliance leads to accumulated late fees of ₹25,000 and potential termination if not resolved within 30 days.

long_term.label: Year 1
long_term.description: First year cumulative costs including base payments and estimated fees

long_term.label: Year 2
long_term.description: Second year cumulative costs with potential amendments and increased scope

long_term.label: Year 3
long_term.description: Third year cumulative costs including full term with all deliverables

risk_alerts.message: Failure to maintain insurance coverage as per Section 6 may result in immediate termination for default and significant financial penalties.
Delayed submission of progress reports or invoices beyond 45 days can lead to payment holds and accumulation of late fees under Section 2E.
Non-compliance with indemnification clauses in Section 5 may expose CONSULTANT to unlimited liability for damages and legal costs.
Unauthorized subcontracting or personnel changes without COMMISSION approval violates Section 1C and 20, risking termination.
